**INSTITUTION Consultation Name: **NAME[AAA, BBB] Acct #: **ID-NUM MRN: **ID-NUM Admitted: **DATE[Jun 04 2007] Date: **DATE[Jun 05 2006] Dict: **NAME[CCC, VVV] Attend: **NAME[ZZZ, YYY] REASON FOR CONSULTATION: Complete heart block and the need for pacemaker. HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS: This is a **AGE[in 70s]-year-old man who has a history of CAD and bundle branch block, MI, etc, and came to the emergency department today after having severe chest pain after ambulating in his yard. The patient is found to have complete heart block with a heart rate of 36 per minute and the pain has disappeared after he was seen in the emergency department and MI was ruled out. The patient has been on medications including ASA 81 mg p.o. q. day, metoprolol 25 mg p.o. b.i.d., Pepcid 20 mg p.o. q. day, Lasix unspecified dosage, and Lipitor 40 mg p.o. q. day. Some of the past medical histories include angina, hypertension, myocardial infarction, GERD, removal of kidney stone using laser and this was done at **INSTITUTION in the past. The patient also had 2 back operations by Dr. **NAME[UUU] at **NAME[TTT] Hospital about 10 years ago, because of back pain. Otherwise, he claims to have had generally good health. Echocardiogram done a few months ago was allegedly about 48% LVEF. The patient is being looked at in the coronary care unit where she is in stable condition. SOCIAL HISTORY: He is just back from Syria where he was born. He quit smoking about 10 years ago. Denies alcoholic habits and CLAIMS ALLERGY TO POSSIBLY PROTONIX, BUT WE ARE NOT QUITE SURE. He is a retired business man. He lives with his wife. He has 3 children. FAMILY HISTORY: Noncontributory. PHYSICAL EXAMINATION: He is 5 feet 2 inches in height, 220 pounds in weight, blood pressure 140/50, heart rate 36, afebrile, and respirations 18 on room air. Well-developed, well-nourished, elderly male in no distress. HEENT: Normocephalic. Clear conjunctivae. Pupils equal and reactive to light and accommodation. EOM intact. ENT: Patent without discharge. The patient has dentures. Tongue is pink and moist. Neck is supple with central trachea. No enlarged thyroid. No palpable nodes. Neck veins are flat. Carotid pulses are intact without bruits. Heart sounds 1 and 2. There may be a soft 1/6 systolic murmur at the precordium. Heart sounds are distant because of increased AP diameter over the chest. Lung sounds generally clear. Abdomen is unremarkable. Extremities show no ankle edema. No clubbing or cyanosis. He has good pulses. ASSESSMENT AND RECOMMENDATION: Fully informed consent has been obtained having discussed the procedure risks and alternatives for insertion of permanent DDDR pacemaker, and this is to be done on **DATE[Jun 5 2006]. Thank you very much for the opportunity to observe this gentleman at this time. ______________________________ **NAME[VVV CCC], MD HS Job # 510922 / 36231 / SHY # **ID-NUM D: **DATE[Jun 05 2007] 07:53 T: **DATE[Jun 05 2007] 08:10
**CARBON-COPY
